content: Prayer for Rescue from Enemies.
To the Chief Musician; set to [the tune of] “Do Not Destroy.” A Mikhtam of David, [a record of memorable thoughts] when Saul sent men to watch his house in order to kill him.
Set me  on an inaccessibly high place away from those who rise up against me.
Deliver me from those who practice wrongdoing,
And save me from bloodthirsty men.
Look! They lie in wait for my life;
Fierce  powerful men [are uniting together to] launch an attack against me,
Not for my wrongdoing nor for any sin of mine, O .
They run and set themselves against me though there is no guilt in me;
Stir Yourself to meet  help me, and see [what they are doing]!
You, O  God of hosts, the God of Israel,
Arise to punish all the nations;
Spare no one  do not be merciful to any who treacherously plot evil.
They return at evening, they howl  snarl like dogs,
And go [prowling] around the city.
Look how they belch out [insults] with their mouths;
Swords [of sarcasm, ridicule, slander, and lies] are in their lips,
For , “Who hears us?”
But You, O , will laugh at them [in scorn];
You scoff at  deride all the nations.
